results.title: The Snow queen
results.creator_credit: Martin Gates, Carrington Productions and Martin Gates Productions
results.brief_description: Based on Hans Christian Anderson’s fairy tale, this is a story of kidnapping, magic and the heroic adventure of a young girl, Ellie, to thwart the evil Snow Queen who plots to turn the world to ice. After her brother is kidnapped by the Snow Queen to help her build a mirror to deflect the sun and freeze the planet, the courageous Ellie begins a journey with a reluctant bird named Peep. With a little help from magic she sets out to rescue her brother and defeat the Snow Queen. Released by Warner Brothers Family Entertainment this is an engaging story of adventure and the classic triumph of good over evil.

results.title: Only angels have wings
results.brief_description: Cary Grant heads a ramshackle cargo outfit in the wilds of South America, forced to fly in the most perilous of weather conditions to the most treacherous of destinations. Facing death on a near-hourly basis, Grant and his flyers have adopted a casual, all-in-a-day’s work attitude towards their mortality. Bringing more than a touch of glamour, and tension, to the sleepy one-saloon outpost is a showgirl (Jean Arthur) on her way to a nightclub engagement in Panama, and a fellow aviator’s beautiful wife (Rita Hayworth). Cast includes: Cary Grant, Jean Arthur, Rita Hayworth, Richard Barthelmess and Thomas Mitchell.

results.title: The One that got away
results.creator_credit: Roy Baker, Julian Wintle and Rank Organisation Film Productions
results.brief_description: This is the dramatic true story of the only German prisoner of war taken in Britain who escaped from captivity and successfully returned to Germany; Luftwaffe pilot Lieutenant Franz Von Werra (Hardy Kruger). Von Werra was captured during the Battle of Britain when his Messerschmitt was shot down in the English countryside. The film is significant in that it was made during the period after World War 2 when the majority of British films paid homage to the heroism of British troops. Von Werra’s meticulous and determined bid for freedom took him across England, Canada, the United States, until he finally reached home. Screenplay by Howard Clewes from the book by Kendal Burt and James Leasor. Cast includes Hardy Kruger, Colin Gordon, Michael Goodliffe and Terence Alexander.

results.title: The Malta story
results.creator_credit: Brian Hurst, Peter de Sarigny and British Film-Makers Limited
results.brief_description: RAF camera reconnaissance pilot Peter Ross (Alec Guinness) is trapped on the island of Malta when his plane is destroyed enroute to Egypt in a bombing raid. While in Malta, Ross discovers that Italy is planning to invade, but the mission is thwarted as Allied control prevents the attack. With the Allied presence in place, Peter begins the dangerous task of tracing an enemy convoy carrying supplies to the German Army in North Africa, a mission that is fraught with danger, as communication to the Allied forces will alert the enemy to Peter’s position. Cast includes Alec Guinness, Jack Hawkins, Anthony Steel, Muriel Pavlow and Flora Robson.

results.title: Journey to the seventh planet
results.creator_credit: Sydney Pink, Alta Vista Productions and Cinemagic Productions
results.brief_description: This passable low-budget science fiction oddity stars John Agar as the leader of a scientific mission to Uranus (not mentioned in the movie’s title in order to avoid the inevitable chuckles), where the crew fall under the control of a powerful psychic force apparently emanating from the planet itself. The entity in question is able to tap into the astronauts’ minds, giving physical form to both their greatest desires and most terrifying nightmares. As a B-movie, this film certainly rates high as a premise to “2001 a Space Odyssey” and “Solaris”.

results.title: I live in fear = record of a living being = Ikimono no kiroku
results.creator_credit: Akira Kurosawa, Shojiro Motoki and Toho Kabushiki Kaisha
results.brief_description: Kiichi Nakajima (Mifune) decides to relocate his family to the safe haven of Brazil from what he perceives is a nuclear holocaust. His methods of getting them there, by burning down their foundry, leads to his incarceration when the family commits him for being criminally insane. From the confines of the asylum Kiichi drifts into a fantasy world where he believes that the sun is an inferno created by the Earth when it exploded in a nuclear holocaust. ‘I Live in fear’ is Kurosawa’s blatant criticism of the perils of nuclear warfare, and was produced at the height of the Cold War when the United States, Britain and the Soviet Union were all experimenting with nuclear testing. The destruction of Hiroshima and Nagasaki was also a recent and painful memory. This a powerful study of patriarchy in Japanese society, and what Kiichi is willing to do to convince his family to support his beliefs. Although unpopular at the box office compared to his other films, Kurosawa thought of this film as one his most proudest moments, and thus deserves due consideration. Cast includes Toshiro Mifune, Kyoko Aoyama, Minoru Chiaki and Kamatari Fujiwara.

results.title: The Last time I saw Paris
results.creator_credit: Richard Brooks, Jack Cummings and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: Charles Wills (Van Johnson) is a GI with literary ambitions who goes to Paris and meets and falls in love with the wealthy Helen Ellswirth (Elizabeth Taylor). Charles’ ambition to write a novel falls to pieces as failure to sell his writing causes him to turn to alcohol. During a drunken argument Johnson accidentally locks Helen out of their Parisian apartment, causing her to catch a fatal dose of pneumonia. When Helen dies, custody of their child is granted to Helen’s sister, who always disapproved of her sister’s abusive partner. Shocked into action, Charles returns home and finally finds success as a writer, and the conviction to try and regain custody of his daughter. Based on the tragic love story by F. Scott Fitzgerald. Cast also includes Donna Reed, Walter Pidgeon and Eva Gabor. The tape also includes interviews with Liz Taylor and Richard Burton on literary roles as well as Donna Read on location and in rehearsal.

results.title: Crocodile Dundee: Crocodile Dundee II
results.creator_credit: John Cornell, Rimfire Films, Hoyts and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: This double set features Australia’s highest grossing comedy film, ‘Crocodile Dundee’, and its significantly less successful sequel. ‘Crocodile Dundee’ (Producer: John Cornell, Director: Peter Faiman) A New York reporter is intrigued by stories of an Australian crocodile hunter and accompanies him on a journey through the bush. She entices him back to Manhattan where his easy-going approach to the dangers of life in a big city make him a success in New York society. ‘Crocodile Dundee II’ (Producers: John Cornell, Jane Scott, Director: John Cornell) begins in New York where Dundee now lives with his journalist girlfriend, who he managed to secure in the first film. In order to escape the pursuit of an international drug ring who have murdered her former husband, Dundee and his girlfriend return to the Australian outback where Dundee is well prepared to confront them. Cast includes Paul Hogan, Linda Kozlowski, John Meillon, Mark Blum and David Gulpilil.

results.title: Thieves like us
results.creator_credit: Robert Altman, Jerry Bick and United Artists Corporation
results.brief_description: Keith Carradine is cast as Bowie, one of three criminals who escape from prison and after a period of good behaviour, fall back into crime by committing a series of bank robberies. In typical ‘Bonnie and Clyde’ (303821) fashion, Bowie falls in love with Keechie (Shelley Duvall), the daughter of the farmer who helped them escape, and she too joins them in their escapades. Bowie and Keechie plan to escape to Mexico, but their dreams for a new start are doomed by the behaviour of the other two criminals, and the couple are destined for tragedy. This remake of the ‘They live by night’ (1948), is based on the novel by Edward Anderson. Cast includes Keith Carradine, Shelley Duvall, John Schuck, Bert Remsen and Louise Fletcher.

results.title: Night on earth
results.brief_description: This film by the talented independent director, Jim Jarmusch, is a collection of five vignettes each taking place in the confines of a taxi ride. Covering one night on earth, the stories occur simultaneously in five different cities and five different time zones: Los Angeles, New York City, Paris, London and Helsinki. Highlights include Roberto Benigni as the Roman taxi driver who recounts his past sexual exploits to a priest who is dying of a heart-attack in the back seat. In the New York scene a novice East German taxi driver (Armin Mueller-Stahl) has trouble with the foot pedals and his passenger ends up driving himself to Brooklyn. Cast includes Gena Rowlands, Rosie Perez, Giancarlo Esposito, Winona Ryder, Beatrice Dalle.
